etymologies: mid 17th century: from triple, on the pattern of doublet

definitions: one of three children or animals born at the same birth

examples.text: the lamb was a triplet and small

shortDefinitions: one of three children or animals born at same birth

definitions: a set or succession of three similar things

examples.text: the boxer's jab came in triplets

shortDefinitions: set or succession of three similar things

definitions: a group of three equal notes to be performed in the time of two or four.
shortDefinitions: group of three equal notes to be performed in time of two

definitions: a set of three rhyming lines of verse.
shortDefinitions: set of three rhyming lines of verse

definitions: an atomic or molecular state characterized by two unpaired electrons with parallel spins.
shortDefinitions: atomic or molecular state characterized by two unpaired electrons with parallel spins

definitions: a group of three associated lines close together in a spectrum or electrophoretic gel.
shortDefinitions: group of three associated lines close together in spectrum or electrophoretic gel
